summary: Cada misión secundaria será una historia completa en Cyberpunk 2077
title: Cada misión secundaria será una historia completa en Cyberpunk 2077
body:
Cada misión secundaria será una historia completa en #Cyberpunk2077

CD Projekt RED ha estado hablando de las misiones secundarias de su próximo juego RPG Cyberpunk 2077 sobre como dichas misiones van ligadas a las misiones principales de la historia y la importancia que tienen las mismas dentro del propio juego.

En la edición de noviembre de EDGE,  Cyberpunk 2077  aparece en la portada principal, y como se esperaba, las misiones secundarias son una de las muchas…

View On WordPress

blog.name: thefalloutscrolls
blog.title: [scroll down]
blog.description:
Whatever crosses my mind in relation to computer games; mostly screenshots. I'm also playing around with a stitching program so expect some screenshot panoramas (they're tagged #panorama).
I'm aiming for a high original content ratio. Y'know, as original as screenshots of games that I had no part in making can be ;)
Fallout 3, New Vegas, and Skyrim dominate the blog so far. I'm planning to play a bunch of other games shortly though, so expect some Witcher, Bioshock, Deus Ex, Dishonored, or some such.
Like what you like, reblog what you want, feel free to ask me anything on and off topic, you know the drill. (Feel entirely free to remove my comments when reblogging, btw.)
Have fun!

summary: Not much to see here until the actual functions of the stats are known in more detail. Cool is a cross between reputation and...
caption:
Not much to see here until the actual functions of the stats are known in more detail. Cool is a cross between reputation and charisma.

Just in case you’re tardy to the party (even tardier than me, that is): in a departure from the source material, there will be no classes. The source material is a pen and paper rpg though, where a diverse class system makes much more sense than in a singleplayer game. A “fluid class system” as CDPR calls it make much more sense here, imo. Assuming of course that interesting specializations are possible and meaningful. None of that master smith+alchimist+enchanter+swordsman+thief+archer nonsense that’s made all my characters play alike in Skyrim.

At this point though, I’m wonderin in what way - if at all - the fluid class system adds an additional layer on top of simply leveling, picking perks, or implants. In Witcher 3, we had to specialize as well, but I wouldn’t call that a class system.

At this point though, I’m wonderin in what way - if at all - the fluid class system adds an additional layer on top of simply leveling, picking perks, or implants. In Witcher 3, we had to specialize as well, but I wouldn’t call that a class system.
trail.content:
Not much to see here until the actual functions of the stats are known in more detail. Cool is a cross between reputation and charisma.

Just in case you’re tardy to the party (even tardier than me, that is): in a departure from the source material, there will be no classes. The source material is a pen and paper rpg though, where a diverse class system makes much more sense than in a singleplayer game. A “fluid class system” as CDPR calls it make much more sense here, imo. Assuming of course that interesting specializations are possible and meaningful. None of that master smith+alchimist+enchanter+swordsman+thief+archer nonsense that’s made all my characters play alike in Skyrim.

At this point though, I’m wonderin in what way - if at all - the fluid class system adds an additional layer on top of simply leveling, picking perks, or implants. In Witcher 3, we had to specialize as well, but I wouldn’t call that a class system.

summary: Decisions aren’t going to be black and white in this game but you can bet your sweet ass if the option comes to save Jackie over...
body:
Decisions aren’t going to be black and white in this game but you can bet your sweet ass if the option comes to save Jackie over a bunch of strangers, I’m gonna choose Jackie every damn time!

Screw the consequences!

summary: Honestly, I don't get some people —that even didn't know about the lore. got angry at the whole 'what makes you human' approch...
body:
Honestly, I don’t get some people —that even didn’t know about the lore. got angry at the whole ‘what makes you human’ approch here. Like on the pen and paper game, the thing that makes you go into cyberspychosis are the implants as guns and mods for eyes and such.

Not the apperence ones or prothesis.

title: Cyberpunk 2077 - Jede Entscheidung zählt
body:
Cyberpunk 2077 – Jede Entscheidung zählt

Nach dem erfolgreichen Action-Rollenspiel “The Witcher 3” arbeiten nun die polnischen Entwickler von CD Projekt RED an ihrem nächsten Blockbuster, dem Sci-Fi-Rollenspiel “Cyberpunk 2077” und wie Senior Quest Designer Philipp Weber nun verspricht, werden die Spieler  immer wieder vor schwerwiegende Entscheidungen stehen. 

In den vergangenen Wochen betonten die Entwickler von CD Projekt RED immer…

summary: Another thing to note from that Edge article, is that they said Night City will have no invisible walls and all areas will be...
body:
Another thing to note from that Edge article, is that they said Night City will have no invisible walls and all areas will be accessible at all times. You might go somewhere and find something that is needed for a later quest, but until then you can just keep it.

This is so interesting because so many times in games are you stopped from going to a certain area, or locked out a building because you’re not level 69.

Bring it on Cyberpunk 2077!

summary: O tweet transfóbico da conta do game Cyberpunk faz parte de um problema algo muito maior
title: O tweet transfóbico da conta do game Cyberpunk faz parte de um problema algo muito maior
body:
O tweet transfóbico da conta do game Cyberpunk faz parte de um problema algo muito maior

O que acontece na internet não fica na internet. Para melhor ou pior, nossa cultura é moldada pelo que acontece nas redes sociais. Quando a cultura on-line se torna tóxica e regressiva, o mesmo acontece com nossas vidas e vice-versa. Se nossas vidas são tóxicas, é improvável que tornemos os espaços on-line mais positivos. Os memes que compartilhamos possuem poder, e esse poder pode ser, e tem…

summary: Dok čekamo Cyberpunk 2077, tu je Cyberslav!
title: Dok čekamo Cyberpunk 2077, tu je Cyberslav!
body:
Dok čekamo Cyberpunk 2077, tu je Cyberslav!

Do izlaska jedne od najočekivanijih igara današnjice, Cyberpunk 2077, ćemo se još uvek načekati bar do 2020. godine, ako ne i više, no po onome što smo do sada videli, vredi čekati.

Ipak, jedan drugi sajberpank projekat koji nam takođe dolazi sa slovenskih podneblja nam je ovih dana skrenuo pažnju. Radi se o animiranom filmu Киберслав/Cyberslav, na kome radi Evil Pirate studio iz Sankt…

summary: Unsurprisingly, V’s name is “missing data”, to be entered by the player. His/her date of birth is listed as 2054 though, which...
caption:
Unsurprisingly, V’s name is “missing data”, to be entered by the player.

His/her date of birth is listed as 2054 though, which would make V a mere 23 years old in 2077. I smell a good story about how he/she teamed up with grizzled old street veteran Jackie - particularly since Jackie is clearly a Night City resident whereas V is new to the sprawl.

The backstory menu features submenus for Childhood Hero, Key Life Event, and Why Night City? It’s not clear what impact these choices will have, but I’m hoping for something more than alternative dialogue lines. The voiceover does seem promising though … (”What you choose here will unlock different possibilities later on.”)

While the choices are sufficiently vague to allow for roleplaying, it’s clear that our character is a street kid. Key Life Events do not include “not getting second cyberpony for birthday”.

I also wonder whether Education and Prior Convictions, left blank for now, will actually serve a function or just exist for aesthetic purposes. Perhaps I’m reading too much into this, but given that V just moved to Night City, this may be a new and incomplete data set. (On the lower right, it says Night City Recognition Program - perhaps suggesting an automated data gathering protocol.)

reblog.comment:
Unsurprisingly, V’s name is “missing data”, to be entered by the player.

His/her date of birth is listed as 2054 though, which would make V a mere 23 years old in 2077. I smell a good story about how he/she teamed up with grizzled old street veteran Jackie - particularly since Jackie is clearly a Night City resident whereas V is new to the sprawl.

The backstory menu features submenus for Childhood Hero, Key Life Event, and Why Night City? It’s not clear what impact these choices will have, but I’m hoping for something more than alternative dialogue lines. The voiceover does seem promising though … (”What you choose here will unlock different possibilities later on.”)

While the choices are sufficiently vague to allow for roleplaying, it’s clear that our character is a street kid. Key Life Events do not include “not getting second cyberpony for birthday”.

I also wonder whether Education and Prior Convictions, left blank for now, will actually serve a function or just exist for aesthetic purposes. Perhaps I’m reading too much into this, but given that V just moved to Night City, this may be a new and incomplete data set. (On the lower right, it says Night City Recognition Program - perhaps suggesting an automated data gathering protocol.)

trail.content_raw:
Unsurprisingly, V’s name is “missing data”, to be entered by the player.

His/her date of birth is listed as 2054 though, which would make V a mere 23 years old in 2077. I smell a good story about how he/she teamed up with grizzled old street veteran Jackie - particularly since Jackie is clearly a Night City resident whereas V is new to the sprawl.

The backstory menu features submenus for Childhood Hero, Key Life Event, and Why Night City? It’s not clear what impact these choices will have, but I’m hoping for something more than alternative dialogue lines. The voiceover does seem promising though … (”What you choose here will unlock different possibilities later on.”)

While the choices are sufficiently vague to allow for roleplaying, it’s clear that our character is a street kid. Key Life Events do not include “not getting second cyberpony for birthday”.

I also wonder whether Education and Prior Convictions, left blank for now, will actually serve a function or just exist for aesthetic purposes. Perhaps I’m reading too much into this, but given that V just moved to Night City, this may be a new and incomplete data set. (On the lower right, it says Night City Recognition Program - perhaps suggesting an automated data gathering protocol.)
